'''Ramin Djawadi''' (born 1974) is a Grammy-nominated German composer of music for film and television. He is of German and Iranian decent. A protege of [[wikipedia:Hans Zimmer|Hans Zimmer]], he produced individual pieces of music for ''[[wikipedia:The Time Machine (2002 film)|The Time Machine]]'', ''[[wikipedia:Basic (film)|Basic]]'', ''[[wikipedia:The Recruit|The Recruit]]'' and ''[[wikipedia:Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl|Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl]]''. He collaborated with Zimmer on the music for ''[[wikipedia:Thunderbirds (film)|Thunderbirds]]'', ''[[wikipedia:Something's Gotta Give (film)|Something's Gotta Give]]'' and ''[[wikipedia:Batman Begins|Batman Begins]]''.

Striking out on his own, Djawadi has produced the theme music for the movies ''[[wikipedia:Blade: Trinity|Blade: Trinity]]'', ''[[wikipedia:The Unborn (2009 film)|The Unborn]]'', ''[[wikipedia:Mr. Brooks|Mr. Brooks]]'', ''[[wikipedia:Deception (2008 film)|Deception]]'', ''[[wikipedia:Ask the Dust (film)|Ask the Dust]]'', ''[[wikipedia:Open Season (film)|Open Season]]'' and ''[[wikipedia:Open Season 2|Open Season 2]]''. His highest-profile work in film has been providing the theme music for ''[[wikipedia:Iron Man (film)|Iron Man]]'' and ''[[wikipedia:Clash of the Titans (2010 film)|Clash of the Titans]]''. In television he has provided the main title music for ''[[wikipedia:FlashForward|FlashForward]]'' , ''[[wikipedia:Prison Break|Prison Break]]'' and ''[[wikipedia:Person_of_Interest_(TV_series)|Person of Interest]]'',  also having worked on ''[[wikipedia:Threshold (TV series)|Threshold]]'' and ''[[wikipedia:Blade: The Series|Blade: The Series]]''. He has also worked in computer gaming, providing the soundtrack for [[wikipedia:Medal of Honor (2010 video game)|the 2010 reboot of the ''Medal of Honor'' series]].

In ''[[Game of Thrones]]'', Djawadi is providing the main title theme and incidental music, replacing [[Stephen Warbeck]] whose withdrawal from the project was announced on 3 February 2011.
